channel.title: Rscd External Ip problem - please read
channel.description:
I can log on ingame in rscd locally, but when i try to change the localhost in world.xml, lsconf, and conf to external ip so other players can logon i get this error.
[java] Login Server starting up... [java] Connected to MySQL [java] LoginEngine now running [java] java.net.BindException: Cannot assign requested address: bind [java] at sun.nio.ch.Net.bind(Native Method) [java] at sun.nio.ch.ServerSocketChannelImpl.bind(ServerSocketChannelIm pl.java:119) [java] at sun.nio.ch.ServerSocketAdaptor.bind(ServerSocketAdaptor.java: 59) [java] at org.apache.mina.transport.socket.nio.SocketAcceptor.registerN ew(SocketAcceptor.java:363) [java] at org.apache.mina.transport.socket.nio.SocketAcceptor.access$80 0(SocketAcceptor.java:55) [java] at org.apache.mina.transport.socket.nio.SocketAcceptor$Worker.ru n(SocketAcceptor.java:222) [java] at org.apache.mina.util.NamePreservingRunnable.run(NamePreservin gRunnable.java:51) [java] at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:619) [java] Java Result: 1 _____ Anyone know how to fix so other players can logon?

item.title: Rscd External Ip problem - please read
item.dc:creator: @fruitloopdeadox fruitloopdeadox
item.description:
@fruitloopdeadox wrote:

I hosted a server ( Divine Pk ) before and it worked, and Lan Ip says i dont have permission to connect to the sql server.

Read full topic

item.title: Rscd External Ip problem - please read
item.dc:creator: @Pan_Cakes Pan^Cakes
item.description:
@Pan_Cakes wrote:

FARXAD: Lol… It’s the router… i have a router named Belkin, but it’s soo fucked can’t port forward with some routers…If u wan’t to host then just buy a dedi.

Read full topic
item.source: Rscd External Ip problem - please read

item.title: Rscd External Ip problem - please read
item.dc:creator: @KO9 KO9
item.description:
@KO9 wrote:

You need to use your LAN IP Addr

start -> run -> cmd -> ipconfig

It’ll probably be something like 192.168.1.x

Read full topic
item.source: Rscd External Ip problem - please read

item.title: Rscd External Ip problem - please read
item.dc:creator: @fruitloopdeadox fruitloopdeadox
item.description:
@fruitloopdeadox wrote:

i did portforward all the ports but no one can connect when all the hosts and ls ip are localhost.

43594 43595 3306 80 34522 8181

And yet no one can logon server? anyone know why
[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 04, 2008, 07:33:28 pm[/size][hr]when i leave all the hosts to localhost no one can connect and ive hosted a server on divine pk v 5

Read full topic
item.source: Rscd External Ip problem - please read

item.title: Rscd External Ip problem - please read
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Don’t change the host from localhost. You want the server to run from localhost. You don’t even change the port; all you do is enable your router’s port-forwarding feature - http://www.portforward.com/

Read full topic
item.source: Rscd External Ip problem - please read

item.title: Rscd External Ip problem - please read
item.dc:creator: @ownagesbot ownagesbot
item.description:
@ownagesbot wrote:

How is that an external IP problem?

I only scanned over it, but it looks asif the port is already in use or something since it can’t bind.

Read full topic
